name: Heart Women & Girls
mission: We work to promote sexual health, uproot gendered violence, and advance reproductive justice by establishing choice and access for the most impacted Muslims.
theoryOfChange: HEART Women & Girls has a published 'Mission / Vision / Values' page that outlines their strategic framework. Their mission is 'To promote sexual health, uproot gendered violence, and advance reproductive justice by establishing choice and access for the most impacted Muslims.' They describe 'how we do it' through health education, advocacy, research, and training. The framework also defines their understanding of reproductive justice and addresses gendered Islamophobia. They aim to build a world where all Muslims are safe to exercise self-determination, autonomy, and control over their reproductive lives and sexual well-being.

evaluationSources: Loyola University Chicago (Center for Urban Research and Learning)
Grow Power Fund Grant (Third Wave Fund)
Birth Justice Initiative Grantee Partner (Ms. Foundation For Women)

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.heartwomenandgirls.org/zakat (Source: https://www.heartwomenandgirls.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

score_details.score_summary: Heart Women & Girls shows good alignment and good impact, with zakat compliance (significant risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.heartwomenandgirls.org/zakat (Source: https://www.heartwomenandgirls.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: HEART maintains a program expense ratio of 74.8% and total revenue of $1,089,496.
The organization is zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories for fund distribution.
Financial data confirms working capital of 25.6 months and fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised.
The organization offers various donation options to support its health education and advocacy programs.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its strong financial health and efficient fundraising, balanced against a need for more direct impact evidence.
areas_for_improvement: Limited third-party impact verification data currently available
Moderate overall data confidence score of 0.63

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high alignment for Muslim donors with a score of 31/50, driven by its zakat-eligible status and focus on domestic community needs [2]. It addresses urgent issues of sexual health and violence prevention through culturally specific frameworks [3][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: HEART demonstrates solid financial health with a total revenue of $1,089,496 and a program expense ratio of 74.8% [1][3]. While the organization focuses on capacity building and education, the impact score of 29/50 reflects a balanced outlook where financial management is strong but external evidence of long-term outcomes is still developing [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: HEART Women & Girls empowers Muslim communities through sexual health literacy and the prevention of sexual violence.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 74.8%, indicating a strong focus on direct service delivery
Exceptional fundraising efficiency at $0.11 per $1 raised
Robust financial stability with 25.6 months of working capital
baseline_narrative.summary: HEART provides health education, advocacy, and research to promote reproductive justice and sexual health within Muslim spaces [1][3]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, applying donations toward specific asnaf categories to support its mission [2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its strong financial health and efficient fundraising, balanced against a need for more direct impact evidence.

areas_for_improvement.context: The organization currently has a small board size, which may limit oversight capacity.
There is limited third-party impact verification data currently available.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The organization maintains strong financial stability and efficiency metrics.
case_against.summary: The primary concerns relate to governance and impact measurement.

confidence.notes: Moderate data confidence due to some missing metrics.

alignment.improvement: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

credibility.explanation: HEART Women & Girls maintains a Silver Seal of Transparency from Candid and reports <cite id="3">$1,089,496 in total revenue</cite> for 2023.
credibility.improvement: To strengthen credibility, the organization could expand its board size to enhance governance oversight.

impact.explanation: The organization demonstrates strong financial efficiency with a <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 74.8%</cite> and <cite id="1">exceptional fundraising efficiency at $0.11 per $1 raised</cite>.
impact.improvement: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.

rich_narrative.headline: HEART Women & Girls empowers Muslim communities through sexual health literacy and the prevention of sexual violence.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support sexual health literacy and violence prevention within Muslim communities in North America.
donor_motivations: Support reproductive justice and sexual health education
Fulfill zakat obligations through targeted advocacy and education
Invest in capacity building for Muslim communities
giving_considerations: Organization focuses on advocacy and education rather than direct emergency relief
Small board size may be a consideration for some donors
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking direct international humanitarian relief or those requiring extensive third-party impact evaluations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The organization has documented its theory of change and tracks outcomes, though third-party verification is limited.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: HEART builds sexual health literacy by offering sex education and anti-sexual assault advocacy.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence helps ensure donations create real impact and programs are effective.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: The organization has steady revenue growth but specific funding gaps are not fully detailed.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Focuses specifically on sexual health literacy and violence prevention in Muslim communities.

strengths.detail: The organization directs a significant portion of its funding to its mission, with a <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 74.8%</cite>.
HEART demonstrates <cite id="1">exceptional fundraising efficiency at $0.11 per $1 raised</cite>.
The organization maintains robust financial stability with <cite id="1">25.6 months of working capital</cite>.

strengths_deep_dive: HEART Women & Girls demonstrates strong financial efficiency, reporting a <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 74.8%</cite> and <cite id="1">exceptional fundraising efficiency at $0.11 per $1 raised</cite>. The organization also maintains <cite id="1">25.6 months of working capital</cite>, indicating robust financial stability.
rich_narrative.summary: HEART Women & Girls provides health education, advocacy, and research to promote reproductive justice and sexual health within Muslim spaces. The organization reported <cite id="3">$1,089,496 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. HEART is recognized as <cite id="2">zakat-eligible</cite>, applying donations toward specific asnaf categories to support its mission. The organization maintains a <cite id="1">program expense ratio of 74.8%</cite> and demonstrates <cite id="1">exceptional fundraising efficiency at $0.11 per $1 raised</cite>.
